snippet: In defeating Christopher Shays, a longtime fixture in moderate politics in Connecticut, Linda E. McMahon underscored the power of being an outside candidate, as well as a wealthy one.
abstract: Linda E McMahon, former wrestling executive, easily captures Connecticut's Republican Senate primary; in defeating Christopher Shays, a former United States representative and longtime fixture in moderate politics in the state, McMahon underscores the power of being an outside candidate, as well as a wealthy one.

byline.contributor: Robert Davey and Elizabeth Maker contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: In defeating Christopher Shays, a longtime fixture in moderate politics in Connecticut, Linda E. McMahon underscored the power of being an outside candidate, as well as a wealthy one.

headline.seo: Linda E. McMahon Wins Connecticut Senate Primary
headline.main: An Ex-Wrestling Executive Wins a G.O.P. Primary
headline.print_headline: An Ex-Wrestling Executive Wins a G.O.P. Primary
